resources.string:
Nmap Wrapper for Android
Created by Werebug (https://werebug.com)

This is a wrapper around the Nmap network scanner cross-compiled for Android.
This is not an official Nmap application. To know more about Nmap and its features, you can visit the official website at https://nmap.org.

Examples:

- Scan TCP port 443 on example.com
	nmap -p 443 example.com
- Scan top 50 ports and grab banners in your LAN:
	nmap --top-ports 50 -sV 192.168.1.1/24

Some Nmap features require root privileges. If you have a rooted phone, prepend your commands with sudo to run as root:
	sudo nmap -O example.com

Source code, cross-compilation instructions and configuration are available at https://github.com/ruvolof/anmap-wrapper. Feel free to contribute or report bugs on Github.
The flag %1$s is reserved for correct functioning of Nmap Wrapper for Android.
Shows a button to parse the xml output when the scan finishes.
